you'd think this was easy. damn. i don't know where to start. this is SO weird. it's like talking in front of a million people.. or trying to.. and i was never really good at speaking in public. speeches make me nervous. i start sttutttt..stt.. stttuuttuuttttuhh.. uhmmm.. *deep breath*... stututtering! LOL.. :)

whaaaaaaaat???? :) i haven't been able to post anything since the holidays started. things were ABSOLUTELY chaotic here but the noise has died down now and i'm back to my old routine - tv, tv, and more tv. meanwhile, normal people in the normal world are back at work or at school. i don't know if it's just me but it seems like the more i stay at home, the more i don't want to go out. i'm turning 23 at the end of the month and i'm still where i was when i was 22. i don't want to get into a beat-myself-up mode coz once i start one of those.. well it's hard to get out of it but i can't help it. i'm restless, i'm embarassed, i feel useless, worthless, and insecure coz i don't have a job. it's been almost a year since i graduated and i'm still nowhere. i quit the first job i ever had after a month coz i felt like the people were mean to me. or maybe i was just having trouble adjusting to a work environment. maybe it wasn't the right job for me. who knows? my mom thinks i'm just a big softie or a coward maybe. i've always been the girl with the big potential but what's potential when there's no motivation, no drive, no passion, no determination, no courage, no strength behind it. i'm afraid those things i lack and how to get them is one thing i don't know. in college i thought i knew everything. i went to the best university in the country and before that, to one of the best high schools in the country. but no one can teach you what you want or tell you what your purpose in life is. and that's just it. i'm on a big plateau going round and round but not really getting anywhere coz i don't know where to go. I DON'T KNOW WHAT I WANT. i know what i DON'T want though. i don't want to get stuck in a job where i'm not happy. happiness is such an elusive thing. like right now, some people might actually think i have a great life. i mean, i get to choose between a big house or a condo to slug around all day in. i have a great car, good food, nice clothes, bags, shoes, big screen TVs, a cellphone, a laptop - everything. and i don't even have to pay for any of the miscellaneous expenses that come with those things like cellphone bills or gas money or repairs. i have typically everything that generous, loving, wealthy parents would give to their child. it sounds like i'm bragging but i'm not. i'm not proud of the way i'm living my life right now on this damned plateau. i'm totally miserable because i can't just be this. a slug! a clown! a sidekick! i go around and cheer people up or make them laugh. i run a few errands for my parents. but mostly, i'm furniture. that's the most use that i've been to anyone. this can't be all there is to me or for me. i just don't know what i want to do. when i'm alone, i think so much. i worry. i stress. i plan. but nothing happens. they all stay in my head all jumbled up. i can't make up my mind. maybe because most of my life i've been given things before i ask or before i even want it. i don't know how to want or how to make a decision because i'm used to having things served to me on a silver platter. what do i do? it's like i have everything and i have nothing. it doesn't make me feel good to still be living off my parents like this. i know they have money and they don't complain but still it doesn't feel right to me. i want to make my own money, buy my own things, earn my own living. i guess that's another reason why i don't go out much. unless it's an absolute necessity, i avoid asking my parents for money. sometimes i don't even have money to buy a pack of cigarettes so i have to bum off my sister all the time and sometimes she gives me these looks.. it just diminishes me. *deep breath* anyways.. like i said, it's hard for me to stop once i start talking about this. i guess that's why i started EVE'S PLATEAU coz my family, my boyfriend, and my friends are probably gonna sew my lips together if they even suspect i'm gonna start talking about all THAT again. in real life, people always think i'm such a happy-go-lucky laid back person most of the time. they probably wouldn't believe i'm really that bothered with something. usually they think that i just like to bug people with petty things. petty things! it's not trivial to ME! hey, it's my LIFE after all! anyways they always tell me i'm makulit . uuh.. whatever! :p (by the way, i was thinking of changing the URL to just plain "eves.blogspot.com" coz i thought people might have a hard time remembering or spelling "evesplateau.blogspot.com". i mean it's kinda long, but then again a person who can't spell P-L-A-T-E-A-U probably won't be interested in a blog that has it in the title.. right? so the URL stays!).

okay i am probably not pregnant. i got my period. it was lighter than usual though and i heard some people got their periods and still turned out to be pregnant. i get nauseous sometimes but there are lots of other reasons for that. earlier today i got nauseous when i smelled my handwash gel thingy and it never did that before but then again maybe it was just coz i was in a moving vehicle and the driver was satan's prodigy. he drove into the potholes and bumps with a certain disturbing silent glee. sigh. i don't know anymore how to distinguish between wishful thinking and instinct. i TOTALLY thought, felt, sensed, and knew that i was pregnant and maybe that was only coz i really i wanted to be. i'm torn between wanting to take a test so bad just to be sure (maybe hoping to be surprised) and feeling so desperate at the thought that it might be another negative result wanting to save myself from the grief. why is it that human nature causes us to want something that we know or think we can't have? uncertainty again. hello, my friend.

i think i might be pregnant. i missed a pill a day after i had sex... with my boyfriend, of course. i have this nagging suspicion that i am. but it's like i think i'm pregnant every month. my friends don't believe me anymore coz of all the false alarms i've had. something i would never admit to them and even to myself was that those other times, deep inside, i felt like and knew that there's a big chance that i really wasn't pregnant. i wasn't surprised to get my period those other times, not really, just disappointed i guess. i've wanted a baby ever since i found out that i might not ever have kids. i have PCOS (polycystic ovarian syndrome) and my ex-obgyn told me that i might become infertile if i don't get pregnant soon . told me that with a little taunting smile and in a horrifying matter-of-fact tone. in one breath, she sentenced me to a life without children. i love children. i even majored in child development in college. but after what that obgyn told me, i distanced myself from children. i used to hold and play with any baby around. but now it just hurts too much to be close to them knowing that i might never actually have any of my own. since then, i've heard and read lots of more hopeful things about my condition and my new obgyn is a specialist in infertility and she tells me that i have nothing to worry about. still, that monstrous doctor's voice won't go away. so even though i know that this is not the best time for me and my boyfriend to have a baby, i really would be happy if we were blessed with one. anyways, unlike those other times, i have this feeling... it's a kind of certainty... like my body's letting me know something is there... we'll see...

well it's torture for him because he has other things to do and he seems not able to do "things" when i'm around... understandably, of course. he's a very caring guy and he feels very guilty when i'm with him and he has to leave me somewhere while he's painting the fence, hauling wood, blocks, garbage, etc, driving for everybody in his neighborhood (he's that nice), etc. he has A LOT of "things to do", believe me. his family and friends depend on him so much. it's like they can't breathe if he's not around. not that i begrudge them the presence and service of their son/brother/cousin/friend/etc. it's just that... i don't know. i'm haunted by paranoid scenarios like... we're married, my first pregnancy, i'm due, my water breaks, i panic, i can't find him, nobody's home coz it's LABOR day, my family and friends are at the beach, so i wait for him... for hours, i can't take the pain anymore, i finally decide to go to the hospital by myself, and i end up giving birth in a smelly cab with a smelly driver with greasy hands. but hey, at least the fence looks nice. *shudder* i know he'd rather that i'm home safe and comfortable and able to do "things" of my own when he's busy. and heaven forbid i get my hands dirty, helping him out is out of the question. so last weekend when he said he'd be busy with "other things to do" this whole week, i resolved not to call him or go to his house to give him the space everybody always says i oughta give him. so there.

my hair has totally gone wild. and when i say "wild", i mean screeching-monkeys-in-the-jungle WILD. it looks like there's a bird's nest clinging to my skull.. a bird's nest that was chewed by a llama and then spat out. this is what comes of not learning from your mistakes. it all started when i was seven years old. i had really long, straight, smooth, silky, black hair but then my mom had it permed. why? it was the 80's! hello?! goddamn it, we should have just skipped that decade. but then again, the 90's would have been the 80's. oh well. let's not go there. as i was saying, my mom got my hair permed and since then, i've had my hair relaxed, straightened, treated, cellophaned, "hot oil"-ed, colored, waxed, "henna"-ed, creamed, ironed and most recently, rebonded (which is really just ironing but with chemicals). each of those treatments came with promises of beauty and renewal but they all just added to the accumulated damage in the end. each time something new comes along, i'm foolish enough to believe that it will be different from the others. something inside me says, maybe this is it! the holy grail of haircare! the answer! the ONE. but no, they never are. well the downward spiral stops here. i have suffered enough bad hair days to last me forever (you can say i'm having a bad hair lifetime). so from now on, i will go organic on my hair (as much as possible). i will mix up a batch of my own all-natural herbal shampoo if need be. whatever it takes. i've learned my lesson. let this be a warning to you as well. unless live birds laying eggs on your head is the kind of thing that ties in with your image, i suggest you be good to your hair.
